articles.headline: Twitter’s C.E.O., Dick Costolo, Is Set to Exit, Feeling Heat of Criticism
articles.snippet: Twitter faces questions about the future of its messaging service, which is built around text in a world increasingly about photos and video.
articles.abstract: Twitter faces questions about the future of its messaging service, which is built around text in a world increasingly about photos and video.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — After replacing much of Twitter’s top management team last year, Dick Costolo told members of the company’s board that he wanted them to replace him as chief executive, too.
articles.byline: By Vindu Goel and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: ‘Discipline’ for Airlines, Pain for Fliers
articles.snippet: Airline executives’ comments about “discipline,” meaning limiting flights and seats, could be interpreted as invitations to restrict capacity increases to keep fares high.
articles.abstract: Airline executives’ comments about “discipline,” meaning limiting flights and seats, could be interpreted as invitations to restrict capacity increases to keep fares high.
articles.lead_paragraph: At this week’s meeting in Miami of the International Air Transport Association, the annual meeting of the world’s top airline executives, the buzzword was “discipline.”

articles.headline: Once Down, James Murdoch Is Guided Back to the Top
articles.snippet: When he left Britain in the wake of a phone-hacking scandal, the younger Murdoch seemed too tarnished to inherit his father’s mantle.
articles.abstract: When he left Britain in the wake of a phone-hacking scandal, the younger Murdoch seemed too tarnished to inherit his father’s mantle.
articles.lead_paragraph: It would be hard to overstate how bad James Murdoch’s reputation was in London when he left town some three and a half years ago.

articles.headline: For Twitter, Future Means Here and Now
articles.snippet: Twitter should aim to become the first and only app that people load up to comment on the news.
articles.abstract: Twitter should aim to become the first and only app that people load up to comment on the news.
articles.lead_paragraph: Here, in 140 characters or fewer, is some free advice for Twitter’s next chief executive: Focus on live events. People never tire of gabbing about what’s going on right now. Twitter could be the best place for that. Do it fast.

articles.headline: House Rejects Trade Measure, Rebuffing Obama’s Dramatic Appeal
articles.snippet: The vote torpedoed President Obama’s push to expand his trade negotiating power, and probably his chance to secure a legacy-defining trade accord spanning the Pacific Ocean.
articles.abstract: The vote torpedoed President Obama’s push to expand his trade negotiating power, and probably his chance to secure a legacy-defining trade accord spanning the Pacific Ocean.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Hours after President Obama made a dramatic, personal appeal for support, House Democrats on Friday thwarted his push to expand trade negotiating power — and quite likely his chance to secure a legacy-defining accord spanning the Pacific Ocean.

articles.headline: Hillary Clinton Embraces Her Mother’s Emotional Tale
articles.snippet: Sharing that story is a shift for Mrs. Clinton, who in her 2008 campaign was fiercely protective of her mother’s privacy and eager to project an image of strength.
articles.abstract: Sharing that story is a shift for Mrs. Clinton, who in her 2008 campaign was fiercely protective of her mother’s privacy and eager to project an image of strength.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dorothy Howell was 8 years old when her parents sent her away. It was 1927. Her mother and father, who fought violently in the Chicago boardinghouse where the family lived, divorced. Neither was willing to take care of Dorothy or her little sister.

articles.headline: Organic Farmers Object to Whole Foods Rating System
articles.snippet: Under a new program, conventional farmers can earn higher marks than organic farmers, who have long had a close relationship with the grocery chain.
articles.abstract: Under a new program, conventional farmers can earn higher marks than organic farmers, who have long had a close relationship with the grocery chain.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like a whale and the myriad barnacles clinging to its sides, Whole Foods Market and organic farmers have long had a symbiotic relationship.

articles.headline: West Baltimore’s Police Presence Drops, and Murders Soar
articles.snippet: Local leaders say the past six weeks have shown that as much as many residents legitimately fear and distrust the police, the solution must be better policing, not less.
articles.abstract: Local leaders say the past six weeks have shown that as much as many residents legitimately fear and distrust the police, the solution must be better policing, not less.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — From the steps of her New Bethlehem Baptist Church, the Rev. Lisa Weah looked down the block to the open-air drug market outside the bodega on the corner a few hundred feet away.

articles.headline: Taking On Student Debt, and Refusing to Pay
articles.snippet: The ramifications of defaulting and remaining in debt deliberately are usually real and lasting.
articles.abstract: The ramifications of defaulting and remaining in debt deliberately are usually real and lasting.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the last couple of decades, we have been engaged in an enormous national experiment, taking impressionable and often ignorant teenagers and young adults and seeing just how much student loan debt they can handle.

articles.headline: Black or White? Woman’s Story Stirs Up a Furor
articles.snippet: The parents of Rachel A. Dolezal, an N.A.A.C.P. leader in Spokane, Wash., say she is white, and her story has stirred a national debate about racial identity.
articles.abstract: The parents of Rachel A. Dolezal, an N.A.A.C.P. leader in Spokane, Wash., say she is white, and her story has stirred a national debate about racial identity.
articles.lead_paragraph: She has professed an affinity for black people since she was a teenager, when her parents adopted four black children. She chose a college where she could immerse herself in racial issues. She married a black man and built a reputation as an advocate for civil rights.
